Run Python PostCommit
Rebased on top of master.
Run Spark RunnableOnService

Sure. Also if destination is a POJO (v.s. a string), we can then add a
SerializableFunctionWithSideInputs version later without breaking backwards
compatibility. This allows us to postpone that functionality for now.

On Fri, Mar 10, 2017 at 8:12 AM, Eugene Kirpichov <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Interesting. I think in general, and even closer to BEAM-92, it could look
> roughly like this then:
>
> foos.apply(BigQueryIO.Write.to(
>     (foo, window) -> destination,
>     (destination) -> new BigQueryIO.Write.Destination(...table name, schema, other options...),
>     (foo) -> new TableRow(...))
>
> Encapsulating properties of a destination table in a POJO is better than
> representing them as virtual functions.
>
> This requires that all of these functions, here represented as lambdas,
> should statically declare and be able to access side inputs. This could be
> done by shoehorning it into this BigQueryIO.Write.to() API, or could be
> done by adding an abstraction like SerializableFunctionWithSideInputs or
> alike.
>
> —

r: @bjchambers 
Besides adding logic for metrics querying in the Java SDK, I moved the `matches` method from `DirectMetrics` to the parent class `MetricResults` so that other runners can use the functionality without having to duplicate the code (or override the methods if they need something different).

LGTM. I'll merge it.

This PR is technically backwards incompatible, as it changes the type of
Bound to Bound<T>. I guess we could do this separately, however it would be
strange to introduce an unused generic type.

On Mon, Feb 27, 2017 at 10:06 AM, Davor Bonaci <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> This seems like a lot to take for the first stable release. Perhaps we
> should target this for the first release after that one. What we should do
> now is the refactoring of Bound with this in mind, so this can be done
> nicely and compatibly.
>

R: @aaltay for merging

Two things to note:
1) I changed `PartitionFn.partition_for` methods signature to match with the docstring. The idea is to be in sync with other classes.
2) CombinePerKey's Args seems invalid (but I'm not 100% sure): https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/transforms/core.py#L916-L921 .  If you also find it unnecessary I'll update the PR and remove those lines.
Thanks for the super-fast respone @sb2nov ! :)

My thoughts on the CombinePerKey:
We can leave the CombinePerKey as it is in this PR. I can see why it is unnecessary for a derived class which just uses the parent class constructor. But this is a style decision so we should get the opinion of others.

On that note, it might be actually good to validate that `fn` is an instance of type `CombineFn` here similar to a ParDo. https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/transforms/core.py#L596
